newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end weak, recovers from lows.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end weak, recovers from lows.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei stock index futures finished on a defensive note Thursday but bounced off intraday lows in moderately active trade, dealers said.
Futures drifted in the morning in sympathy with Toyko share prices, recovering later on short covering as investment trusts resumed buying to put the Nikkei index back above 19,000.
The key March Nikkei contract ended at 19,285, down 260 points on a total volume of 18,450 lots.
Traders said price volatility contributed to the relatively good post-Christmas volume from mainly Japanese institutions. Some were seen rushing to hedge year-end cash positions.
"Worries about a sell-off from foreigners and technicals, helped market activity," a local commission house trader said.
Foreigners were thought likely to liquidate yen-based assets in view of the bearish Japanese economy.
The market was also hit by technical selling, with a mid-point wave objective of 18,500 points the next target.
"A major reversal pattern for the medium term is 17,500, and we nearly hit the mid-point (18,500) today," the dealer said.
The cash Nikkei, which slipped below 19,000 for the first time in over a year, is both technically and fundamentally weak.
